Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay nearby the commons in downtown Boston”
Reviews.Author: Cobtree
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this old family run hotel nearby the Boston Commons. The receptionist (From Russia) took great care of checking us in and the room was clean albeit small. It is located near to Chinatown and the commons and offers inclusive breakfast at a budget price. We would certainly stay there again when we go back to Boston for a few days

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Location - Clean - Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Azza1989
Reviews.Content: If you want a affordable and clean room to stay, in a wonderful area and close to transport this is your place. Close to the freedom trail, nice restaurants, Newbury st shopping. Stayed for half a week and loved it. Nothing to complain about. Staff dealt with anything minor with a smile on their face and helped with directions. Recommend to anyone wanted a trip to Boston. Will use again. :)

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean, professional, easy - & good location!”
Reviews.Author: ABwanders
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Milner for 3 nights in October 2011. We accidentally planned our trip for the same weekend as the Charles River regatta, and the prices for every hotel were really high. I found the Milner by chance, and they had an open room at a reasonable rate. The location is great - a few blocks south of Boston Common. We walked everywhere, except when we went across to the Cambridge side (we took the T). The hotel itself is great. It has character, but is clean. It's on the small side (small lobby, small breakfast room, narrow hallways, small rooms, but it had everything we needed. Who goes to their hotel when traveling except to sleep anyway?! Free breakfast in the mornings, and the rooms were cleaned daily. Perfect! Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Old Fashioned”
Reviews.Author: Buzzsaw22
Reviews.Content: Old hotel in the theater district close to great restaurants. Small rooms with huge bathrooms. In dire need of privacy and soundproof windows. Great location but noisy. Great continental breakfast. Staff was great and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “added to my favorites”
Reviews.Author: AlF651
Reviews.Content: Room Was small no chairs.but there where 3 of us adults and we loved it here,desk people were nice, breakfest was nice,place was one of the cleanist as far as dust goes could not find any in the room or hallway,we looked on top of pictures`,and woodwork no dust,impressive.beds were comfey, flat screen tv was nice,and there were 2 more bigger flat screens in breakfest lobby area,free usa today& maps of boston, right near boston commons,and China Town.there was a nice man to help with breakfest ,and they had a security gard on duty at nite in the lobby,we all really enjoyed are stay,thanks milner manegemant. there was a smell they use as a cleaner but it disapeared after awhile.

Reviews.Title: “Good position, good service, good price!”
Reviews.Author: biomaucal
Reviews.Content: Situated in the center of the city near Boston Common and the Freedom Trail. it's good for holiday with your friends, girlfriend or with family. It's very confortable (king bed, internet wired, frigo, clear room), the size of room is normal (no small, not very big), the staff is very nice, good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, well located, nice breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Kevin2686
Reviews.Content: About five years ago I was on a round the world trip and stayed here for the Boston leg. When looking at hotels this time I looked all over Boston. But this was the cheapest I could find. Sure it's not the best hotel but let me tell you that it is good value for money. Being single is sometimes a pain when you do a lot of travelling. This hotel is in prime location less than 5 minutes from the Grayline tour office- good cos I had some tours booked. The breakfast was ample - bowl of cereal, bagel and cream cheese and filtered coffee, brilliant. Sure it had quirks like a sloping floor in the bathroom but hey I did not expect 4 stars (if you want a complaint from me read my other review about Maltese hotel).

Reviews.Title: “If location is everything....”
Reviews.Author: Glenda N
Reviews.Content: Despite it's central location, the Milner Hotel was a huge disappointment. Our room was so heavily sprayed with air freshener that it made breathing uncomfortable. Had no choice but to keep window open 24 hours a day X 4 (revealing view of brick wall/fire escape). Open window made sleeping difficult because of non-stop street noise. And about that room .... Holy postage stamp! Staff was not unpleasant, however all lacked basic hospitality training. Breakfast unimpressive (store bought goods). Weak tasteless coffee. Do expect the possibility of standing while nibbling your bagel. Breakfast room space is limited, uninviting, and poorly organized. If you can overlook chipping paint, poor lighting, frayed towels, and opinions above, you may want to stay at the Milner. We won't go back!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: SanDiego_CALouise
Reviews.Content: The Milner Hotel has the feel of a European hotel in a big city: small lobby, small elevator, kind of small rooms, high-rise hotel. We enjoyed a very comfortable room and a quiet night there. It is right in the theater district and within easy walking distance of the Boston Common which also means easy walking to some of the major sites of the city. The price is not cheap but it is very reasonable compared to other hotels in the same area of Boston. All-in-all, we would recommend the Milner for travelers who don't need all the luxuries of a more modern hotel and who want to save some money in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Umprofessional. Personnel and manager”
Reviews.Author: jaasmin
Reviews.Content: very bad attention at the from desk for the manager and personal del hotel.they no give back the money after I decide no stay in the hotel.they went to very route.

Reviews.Title: “GoodLocation”
Reviews.Author: Amy L
Reviews.Content: The room was really small but I came to see Boston and didnt spend much time in the hotel. I was traveling alone and it was close to restaraunts and the subway. Good price for the location. I would not stay here again if I was with someone. The room was too small. But if youre looking to save some money and have a safe place to keep your stuff you should check it out.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: richardalan
Reviews.Content: The principal factors in favour of this hotel are its location and the general helpfulness and attitude of the staff which is very good. It is an old building very well located in the theatre district 3/4 mins from the Common. There was a downside to our stay(husband and wife) - even by UK standards our room barely qualified as a double -approx 12 x 9ft with a 4ft 6in bed. Separate bathroom OK. No desk, one chair, a chest of drawers on which stood an ancient CRT TV and a kettle. Insufficient room to get round the bed and only one bedside light.Airconditioning provided by a window unit. It was very hot and the only alternative was to be deafend by the aircon unit which had been poorly fitted - gap had been partially filled in with cardboard and tape. What it would have been like in high summer does not bear thinking about. A problem arose with the TV and they offered to swap room or change TV. As we had only effectively one night left we opted for the replacement. This produced an even bigger CRT model that almost completely filled the top of the Chest! It did work though!! I did not see any other rooms so cannot comment. I have a suspicion that as we had booked through online travel firm( the hotel website had no vacancies) we may have come at the bottom of the pile. Even then insult was added to injury in that we had to pay tax on top of the quoted price. Breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, ok hotel.”
Reviews.Author: askabrit
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Milner Hotel two nights prior to a cruise. We left it a bit late to book a hotel so were scrambling to find one at a reasonable cost. I don't think any hotel costs reasonable in Boston, this was about $250 a night including tax and breakfast. Our room had two double beds, two windows, one overlooking a narrow alley and the other a brick wall and the room window next door. Shower was good, everything was clean. Breakfast was quite good, nothing hot but the usual cereal, waffles, boiled eggs, toast and fresh fruit etc. Front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. Gave us a list of nearby restaurants to eat dinner with directions. Best of all was the short walk to the 'Freedom Trail' and Commons. Quincy Market was about a 10 - 15 minute walk away too. This hotel met our needs well but was way, way over priced. It is an old hotel with small rooms and the smallest elevator I have seen in a while.

Reviews.Title: “A True "Gem"”
Reviews.Author: kkimy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Boston Sept.18th throught the 23rd, 2011 after spending a week on the Cape. When we got to the Milner we were greeted by Kevin and once we got to our room, I was so very happy. We stayed in 405 which had a double bed, and it was perfect. The hotel has so much character. Our room was very clean, smelled amazing and our bathroom was like brand new.Reina kept our room cleaned perfectly. The continental breakfast was amazing!!! If you're looking for a hotel that is close to everything, the Commons, theaters, subway, shopping and restaurants you should definitely stay here. We were able to return our car and walk everywhere..We even used the laundry facilities and were quite happy with our clothing. Definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small”
Reviews.Author: Ana S
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of its low price combined with a great location. But everything was too small in it: the room, the shower (the smallest we'd ever seen) and the breakfast area (that was always crowded). Although it was not ugly, I wouldn't come back.

Reviews.Title: “Review of Milner Hotel, Boston”
Reviews.Author: yurt345
Reviews.Content: The Milner is a charming little old brownstone hotel in the theater district, very conveniently located. I had a single room. It was about 8' x 10', had one twin bed (a little too hard for my taste), a night table, a desk and chair, a flat screen tv, and a small closet. Everything was very clean. It looked like new carpeting and nice wallpaper. The bathtub/shower had plenty of hot water. The sink was very tiny and you could bump your head on the glass shelf over it if you tried to bend down. The breakfast provided was excellent: fresh fruit salad, hard boiled eggs, oatmeal, cold cereal, waffles, breads and pastries, coffee - really anything you could want. I would definitely stay again if I traveled alone. The double room I asked to see looked claustrophobic for two people, but perhaps that was just the one room I saw.

Reviews.Title: “Small but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: MIew
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Milner with friends and we had a good time. Although the hotel is very old and the room are very small, you are near the Boston Common and near a lot of attractions. The room was clean and smell fresh, for me, it's super important that the hotel provide it and I was well served. If you like big room, do not go there. But if you only want a place to sleep, that is near a lot of thing in downtown and that is not too expansive... well you will be happy with the Milner! The breakfeast is good, but the dinner room is also small. However, they are always trying to give you a table. The service was excellent! However, I would like to advise you that you may found little moist bug on the floor in the washroom.I only had to kill 3 of them. DO NOT WORRY, it's nothing like coachroaches (I double checked everything and didn't find any other bugs). It was my second stay at Boston, and I don't regret my hotel's choice!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: shields3033
Reviews.Content: This moderately priced hotel proved excellent for a solo traveler on a budget. Its location near Boston Common and not far from the subway was ideal. Plenty of restaurants, shopping and theatres in the vicinity. The only disadvantage was the lack of internet connection. For that I had to go to the public library, a great place to visit anyway. The included buffet breakfast was ample and one can make coffee in one's room.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat it-- breakfast included and better than most, AC, Wifi. Ideally located just off Commons.”
Reviews.Author: maxrev
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel online 3-4 weeks prior to my departure, mainly for its great location and price. I was there for 3 nights in the middle of a heat wave and can confirm the A/C works great. 5 min walk to the T orange line in one direction (downtown) and 5 min the other to the Green line (arlington). 7-11 and CVS also close by, as well as corporate-type cages and restaurants (PF Chiang's, CA Pizza Kitchen). Found a great pho noodle house off Washington in China town, maybe 15 min walk. The rooms are small and hallways well-worn, which is consistent with older hotels. However, my room and bathroom were very clean, single twin bed, Tv, nightstand, just about filled in. front desk said You could just about do one downward dog, so yoga people will know what dimensions I'm talking about. I worked at the desk a lot and found it to be more than adequate. front desk said Wifi was only available in lobby, but I had no trouble getting on their network from my room. Warning for those in room 409: there is a plastic ledge intended for toiletries directly above the sink. You WILL hit your head on it when you move to wash your face in the sink, so be careful. A poor design and should be fixed. Breakfast included, better than most: cereal english muffins, baked goods, yogurt, fresh fruit, hard billed eggs, waffle maker (their coffee) is another story. I was working and put a DND sign, which was respected for my entire stay and they gave me a 1 pm checkout. I've read other reviews who mention noise issues. Yes, There was loud music from 7-9 pm most evenings but it wasn't so loud above the humming AC that it was intolerable. Even so, my room did not face the Milner is a pleasant alternative to the big box hotels that seem to dominate City Center.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location. Clean place to sleep in.”
Reviews.Author: AriellaSiri
Reviews.Content: We went to Boston on a last minute trip for Stanley Cup Playoff. Everything else in the city was booked and I found 1 room here popped up less than 24 hours before the plane took off. We didn't expect much but it turned out better than we thought. We got to Boston around 10.30 am and they let us check in early as we have a 2 years old who was very tired. (Luckily they had a room ready for us and even give us a discount for going us a queen size bed instead of 2 doubles.) The location was very conveniently close to subway stops and Chinatown & Theatre districts. The room albeit being old it is relatively clean. Good enough a place to sleep in. You can hear some noise from the street at night but it was not bad. All in all if you can find somewhere better that's great but if you don't, this hotel will do just find.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and great deal”
Reviews.Author: Fireweed108
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and the location can't be beat in the Boston Theatre disrict. If you don't mind schlepping your bags five minutes from the Bolston train station it only costs $2 to get there from the airport. There definitely was no view--the one window opened to a brick walls. But that's ok because I was gone most of the time. Some loud drumming noise coming from the Charles Street Theatre in the early evening (The Blue Man Group was there). But the noise died down in time for sleeping. Some partyers in the next room in the early evening had me waiting with baited breath for sleep time noise levels, but they also calmed down before bedtime. Great breakfast in the morning and very helpful staff--from the front desk to the housekeepers. Cab to the airport cost $20. DSL computer connection in room with fast speeds.

Reviews.Title: “Putting this Hotel to bed.”
Reviews.Author: HotelRockmiser
Reviews.Content: Finally, here is your most accurate representation of this hotel, dead honest. *I showed up to this hotel expecting the worst, expecting horrible, but where the location was, I was going to put up with it all. It was worth it. Now, if you happen to maybe want ritzy, or maybe you expect a mansion sized room, or even expecting great views, if you expect any of this, there's a Radisson across the street. If you want to experience old time hotel atmosphere with newer accomidations, then this place is for you. Keep in mind, I'm writing this review from my bed at the Milner, with possibly the smallest room here, and dang it, I LOVE IT! Keep in mind, hotel rooms were meant to be slept in, that's it when this place was first opened 134 years ago. No TV, no nothing. Now, you got a flat screen TV, with more channels than upscale hotels. This place is really a treasure if you're into a vintage feel, if not, find somewhere else to complain about. But in walking distance from EVERYWHERE that makes Boston great, you can't beat it. The parking (which is not controlled by the hotel is pricey "26 dollars a day") is the only issue I have, other than that, fast internet, great feel. You can't stay in Boston without staying here. You can watch away Boston games, then walk over to Fenway to see the game for real, seriously folks, do it if you're into old time Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for the price!!!”
Reviews.Author: Xumaniti
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in the heart of Boston for a buck it's the right place. My room was very clean and had everything I need, breakfast in the lobby with free Internet. Great great location!!!!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington DC, District of Columbia, USA
Reviews.Title: “Great location and price for downtown Boston”
Reviews.Author: andyward33
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay here for my first trip to Boston. I needed to check in a day early and stay a day later than planned. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They made great recommendations for food and sight seeing. There is lots to do within walking distance of this hotel. This is a historic building in the theater district of Boston so the rooms are pretty small. But it had everything I needed- bed, desk, flatscreen, bathroom. Overall I think the price was pretty decent for downtown in a big city. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “If you like it loud”
Reviews.Author: elchen89
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights. The hotel was, lets say ok, nothing special, but we only want to sleep there. But this was not possible at the weekend because the hotel is in the theatre district. The whole night there was so much noise, that we felt like beeing in the middle of the carnival in Rio. We didnt get one hour of sleep, because the windows were also not very good and didnt keep the noise outside. That was really horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: oxymoron2010
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a night during my visit to the city. The hotel is located in a very convenient location. The staff is very friendly. However, one of them was quite rude. But that was an anomaly. The continental breakfast is just average. The wireless internet was not good. The connection was breaking. The hotel is a good value though.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tiny old room however”
Reviews.Author: Oz_84
Reviews.Content: Cannot beat the location of this hotel, right in the heart of Boston. The room was the smallest i've ever stayed in, with a bed which must be at least 20 years old, it was hard to get a good night sleep here. Pros: Good location, breakfast, cheap, reasonably friendly staff Cons: Rooms tiny, Dirty old interior, very small old bed, small bathroom Overall for the money its a fantastic location, if you can deal with the matchbox sized room then this is for you, if you are not on a budget, i would look elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: roamingjode
Reviews.Content: fairly basic but very helpful staff and a welcome if not basic breakfast in the morning. we found the room too warm but the upside was plenty of hot water.

Reviews.Title: “Best value close to centre”
Reviews.Author: Tych0Brahe
Reviews.Content: By no means a top of the range hotel, but it's very expensive to stay in Boston, and this was by far the cheapest option this close to Boston Common and Stuart St. The room decor was a bit dated, but the space was generally clean and we were only there to sleep anyway. The breakfast was all prepackaged muffins and bagel, etc, but quite satisfactory for a start to the day. Don't expect luxury, but this place is good value.

Reviews.Title: “History does not always equal charm”
Reviews.Author: aeckerson
Reviews.Content: My husband booked a romantic surprise getaway to Boston for our anniversary. After flight delays and arriving on a cold & rainy night (no one's fault), all we wanted was to unload, freshen up, and walk across the street for a lovely meal. Upon arriving at the Milner, they told us our room only had 1 twin bed, even though the printed confirmation said 2 travelers. My husband chatted with them for 15 minutes before they finally got us a room that would accommodate two people. We walked up 5 flights of stairs to our room, because the elevator sounded like it'd be getting stuck between floors at any minute, opened the door & flicked on the lights to see a mouse run out of the room. The one window in the tiny room was not sound-proof at all, so we heard sirens all night. Had our reservation been for any longer than a night, I would have had to find another place to stay. My poor husband felt awful, but how could he have known! Reviews described the place as decent, but I think that's being FAR too generous.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Fl0rida_Fan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights at the end of September. Having searched the internet for reasonably priced hotels in Boston this was the cheapest I could find in the centre of Boston. The location was great, half a block from Stuart Street with loads of restaurants and bars and only a couple of blocks from Boston Common and Chinatown. The room was quite small (though I've stayed in smaller) but it was clean and we didn't spend much time in it other than when we were sleeping. The decor was ageing a bit but not as bad as some of the reviews on here. A continental breakfast was included and was better than expected - a good selection of bagels, muffins, english muffins, waffles, cereal and fresh fruit. The breakfast room was a bit small though for the number of guests! Overall we enjoyed our stay and wouldn't hesitate to book again.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location, but the smallest room we ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: Explorercouple
Reviews.Content: Great location being just 2 blocks from Boston Common and the Freedom Trail. 1-1/2 blocks from Boston Old Town Trolley (which we recommend) and a nice little food court. The room was very small, but we were't there to relax in the room. ..we only needed a place to shower and sleep. Room was clean enough and they have a nice little breakfast area (if you can find a seat in the morning...pretty small). If you want fancy and roomy, this isn't it. If you are budget conscious and just want a "relatively" inexpensive place to stay, this could be what you're looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JTH_BE
Reviews.Content: We used the Milner as our base to explore Boston for a few days. It is perfectly situated near to the Common many restaurants, bars and sights in very short walking distance. The rooms are probably not the average american standard, but are absolutely up to the job. The hotel is situated in an old english style building, very charming. All standard amenities (coffee maker, hairdryer, tv, free wifi, etc.) are available in room. Room and surroundings were clean, tidy and well maintained. Breakfast a bit on the smallish side but people were able to arrange themselves. Attentive service, even cleaning personel very friendly. We'll surely be back in Boston and will book the Milner again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: dp122800
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Milner the night before an early flight to San Francisco because it was the only reasonably priced place in Boston I could find. The hotel was just great for the night,with good places to eat and a short walk to South Station. The room was small but otherwise perfect. The young ladies at the desk were very helpful. Don't let the bad reviews fool you it is a nice place

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: wisestone
Reviews.Content: My wife and I flew into Boston to go up to New England and sight see. We decided to stay a couple nights in Boston to see the town and visit with a friend. The hotel was nice. The rooms were small but acceptable. They had A/C, internet, a nice bed and bathroom, and free breakfast. What else do you need in a hotel? Its very close to the Boston Common and T stops. It acted as a great base to explore the city for us.

Reviews.Title: “Never again...”
Reviews.Author: kadda2
Reviews.Content: ... during our three weeks in the US we also stayed in the Milner Hotel in Boston. But we were really disappointed: The location is great to visit all important things and of course - if you only stay a few days it is ok, BUT (a) rooms were dirty, (b) the bed was sag in the middle (and as it was a queen size bed my husband and I "met" several times in the night), (c) as it is located in the theatre district it was very loud, (d) the air conditioning was from the last century (loud and old) and last but not least (e) it was completely overpriced ($149 per night for something that is more a youth hostel than a hotel). To summarized: We will look for another hotel next time. Even Boston is a really beautiful place it is not so nice if you can't sleep a single night.

Reviews.Title: “The Milner is Allright.”
Reviews.Author: silversmith1770
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Milner for five nights and yes it's old and sort of worn out but I didn't come to Boston to stay in my room. After reading reviews before I got there I was ready to move to another hotel but I stayed and I'm glad did. The rooms were clean and the staff was very nice and attentive to my needs, I suggest you tip your housekeeper. I did use the washer and dryer in the basement but the vending machines were not working, so I had to go down to the 7-11 about a block down and get some Landry soap, which I donated to the hotel when I left. All in all you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Callisto71
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews we were worried about staying at the Milner. First and foremost the hotel is in a great location 5 minutes walk from Boston Common. The hotel is not plush but is comfortable enough, The room we had was a reasonable size. Breakfast is served in a small area but is pretty good. All in all a decent hotel in a great location with plenty of bars and restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Milner Hotel Boston has Rats!!!!!!!Do go if you want ur valuables to be safe.No drinking water in the rooms provided.”
Reviews.Author: Wellwisher_10
Reviews.Content: The most terrible hotel and staff I have ever come across.The hotel rooms have rats, at 2.00 am heard snacks bag moving on its own,when checked in the morning there were bits of the bag on the table and cookies in the bag were all eaten up.The laptop charger worked fine till that night,and was not working in the morning it also had a bitten end. When complained to the hotel staff they just asked us to change the room.When asked for compensation for the loss the rudest manager said that this hotel does not have rats.As if we damaged all the things and bit everthing as rats.Acceptance is the key to success and progress.No one in this world would do it for pleasure and take hardship of changing room when we were suppose to check out in just 18 hours. Good we changed the room or would have been bitten by rats that night. They charge so much and dont have courtesy to keep drinking water in the rooms.Even cheapest hotels have at least a jug of water.Terrible!!!!"Please dont even think of going to this hotel" a free advice from a well wisher.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ElGreco75
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Milner recently and overall it was a great experience. The location is ideal as it it located near two T stops and about 2 blocks from Boston Common in the theater district. The building itself is old and the rooms reflect that, if you are used to large spacious rooms than this may not be for you, however if you are okay with European-sized rooms then you will be fine. Regardless our room was clean, had a a functioning air-conditioner, large enough to have a standard queen sized bed, a sofa, a desk and a mini-fridge. Although the bathroom was a tight squeeze, especially to use the sink and toilet. My only major issue was the door to our room did not close all the way unless one pulled it closed, we discovered this coming back after leaving for a few hours in the evening, luckily nothing was missing and we made sure to close the door thereafter. The only other problem I felt was the breakfast room toaster needed to be replaced as it took forever and really didn't toast that well. Overall I would really recommend the Milner if you are on a budget and like your hotel with a certain charm.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, rooms small but only by US standards”
Reviews.Author: pantherfan99
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Milner for two nights during a two-week tour of the US East Coast. Originally we were supposed to be staying across town but the Icelandic Volcano had other ideas so we changed our plans and stayed at the Milner instead. After browsing some of the reviews I must admit I was a bit apprehensive about staying at the Milner but due to the last minute nature of our arrangements, we couldn't exactly be piccy about our accomodation. The first thing I'd have to say is that the Milner's location is excellent, especially if you are only in Boston for a short time. The hotel is a 2 minute walk from Boston Common and the beginning of the city's famed Freedom Trail. Bus and T connections are frequent from Boyleston station (located at the edge of the common and also within close proximity to the hotel). Secondly, I'd like to dismiss some of the ridiculous claims about customers being unable to move due the size of the rooms at the Milner. Yes they are small, but the hotel doesn't ever claim that they are large and I think it's important to remember that the Milner was built in the Civil War era and not exactly with 21st century needs in mind. So yes, don't expect king-size beds, vast expanses of carpet or faceless furniture fittings - that is all part of the Milner's appeal. If you want all that then go to a large coporate chain hotel (in fact there is one right across the street). In fact I was marginally impressed at the size of the hotel room (not to say that they're large but by the number of over-the-top references on here about the room sizes I was expecting something resembling a shoebox). I have travelled extensively in Europe and the rooms at the Milner are typical of what you'd expect in a similar-type guesthouse in Paris, Rome or Barcelona for example. Having said all that there isn't much space in the lobby or the dining hall (which can be a squeeze on busy mornings) but like I said, that's all part of the Milner appeal. There was plenty of choice for a small breakfast buffet and even a chance to have a go at making your own waffles (this may sound strange but for me and my partner this was a first). The rooms were more than adequate for what me and my partner required which in no particular order wasp; a comfortable bed, plenty of cupboard space, an iron and ironing board, a TV with plenty of channels, adequately-fitted bathroom, towels and a few flyers/magazines about what to do in Boston. All in all the Milner is ok with me.

Reviews.Title: “It would be great for $25 a night but...”
Reviews.Author: Claude05
Reviews.Content: It is a beat down hotel. Carpets are dirty, it is smelly. The pictures do not represent the reality. It is not worth the $230. per night even on high season.

Reviews.Title: “No customer service”
Reviews.Author: zurichtripper
Reviews.Content: Do not trust these people, I booked to stay at the Milner and unfortunately had to cancel my trip to Boston. Despite multiple e-mails to the hotel cancelling my booking I never received any response and was charged a no-show. This is what I call unacceptable. There are far better places to stay that here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good price, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MCJ1000
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week on a business trip. The location is right in the heart of the city, there is LOTS to do within walking distance. This is a very old building with small elevators and very small rooms. However, it's very charming, the rooms are clean, the staff is very friendly. The complimentary breakfast is excellent. I would definitely stay here again. Weekends can get noisy down in this neighborhood with all the Theatres and Bars, so if you like to go to bed early, keep the A/C fan going.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible - didn't stay, they charged us 1night. It's 3 weeks and they don't send the invoice”
Reviews.Author: CMN72
Reviews.Content: We decided not to stay there since it was dirty, noisy and not as advertised in the website. The hotel is definitively not worth $159, not even in Boston. They charged us anyway since we don't cancel on time and the only request was to get the invoice so I can expense it. It's been 3 weeks and still no invoice, she's going to "try" and fax it... I will have a $25 charge for late fees on my credit card since I can't expense it without an invoice. DON'T GO THERE.

Reviews.Title: “Great location- hotel grubby”
Reviews.Author: Neilnric
Reviews.Content: The location of the Milner is perfect- just two minutes from the Common, the sights, the start of the freedom trail and some great good value restaurants. The hotel is good value for a city centre hotel, but the rooms are very small- we had an upgraded room with two double beds. The room was clean but the public areas needed a good vacuum. For a great location at a reasonable price then the Milner is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but neighborhood very noisy at night”
Reviews.Author: sgb2005
Reviews.Content: PROS: - excellent location, near several T line stations, a few blocks from Chinatown, major theaters, and Boston Commons. Walkable to major sights, i.e. start of Freedom Trail, Copley Square. I also walked here in about 10 minutes from South Station. - free breakfast- fruit, fresh waffles, cereal, hard-boiled eggs, all types of pastries, juices/coffee/tea. Also, juices/tea/coffee/water available all day along with candy and apples. - free internet in room via ethernet cable. - relatively clean, though hair in the teeny tiny shower stall - staff has been excellent, especially the breakfast staff. CONS: - EXTREMELY NOISY throughout the night, especially if you have a Friday or Saturday stay and your room faces the street. Honking, loud bass music, people screaming and shouting, engine of motorcycle rumbling, etc. I can't tell where the noise came from as I couldn't see from the window. (by the way, I had earplugs on throughout my stay...and I am still describing it as noisy.....esp as earplugs cannot block out the bass vibrations). i.e. even on a Thursday night, I was awoken throughout the night due to outside noise even with earplugs in. On the other hand, I did not hear noise inside the hotel, so perhaps if you get a room not facing the street... - Rooms are very small. The shower stall is also very very tiny....so it was very difficult to shower...hardly room to turn around in the shower. - Shower pressure very weak....just above a trickle. Combined with the small space, it was hard to shower. - took almost 10 minutes to get lukewarm water...unable to get hot water. Overall: price and location is excellent.....but if you like a good strong shower and are a light sleeper, then another hotel might be more suitable.

Reviews.Title: “Don't always base your choice on others reviews...”
Reviews.Author: lig24eva
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel last minute and wasn't my first choice. A friend recommended another hotel that was booked up I found the Milner using google maps help. I booked a queen deluxe room for one night. On the phone Judd the man who booked my room was very helpful and friendly. After I booked the hotel I looked at a couple of reviews and almost regretted my decision. The reviews talked about bed bugs. I was in a hard place because a lot of the hotels in the area were booked due to a beer event going on over the weekend. I decided to stick with hotel. When we checked in the woman behind the counter was very nice. We got into an extremely SMALL elevator and began our scary journey to the 5th floor. My boyfriend looked at me and I at him as the elevator felt as if it could fall to the ground at any moment. We used the stairs from now on which is a pain because I have recently had knee surgery. On our arrival into our room it was surprisingly small. The bathroom was soooo tiny. You could use the toilet and take a shower at the same time. My boyfriend is a medium built guy and had a hard time even getting into the nook that the sink was in. Water in the shower was hot. Wireless internet was fast and free. Brand new mini fridge that was icy cold. The "queen" bed was the smallest queen bed I have ever seen but I will say I slept well and the sheets were soft and clean. And NO BED BUGS. I checked as soon as we arrived. I looked under the mattress and under the bed itself. Over all I would stay at this hotel again but I don't know if it would be my first choice. I got a feeling of a small hotel from europe.

Reviews.Title: “Modest but fully featured”
Reviews.Author: GenAris
Reviews.Content: Milner hotel is highly recommendable for those travellers who prefer functionality and good (and familiar) service rather than other kind of luxuries like restaurant or room service. It is very comfortable and I was surprised about the amount (and quality) of services included in the price. The bedrooms could seem a little bit small but they have everything you will need, including ethernet cable for free internet access (which works really very well). There is a very good wi-fi internet access in the lobby and breakfast room, and talking about breakfast, the complimentary one is simply excellent. You have a lot of breakfast options (and the quality is really good), and also coffee and fruit juice is free all over the day. Definitely I would recommend it to anyone and for sure I will go there in a future trip

Reviews.Title: “good choice”
Reviews.Author: mauhey
Reviews.Content: convenient. Well located. safe area. Clean. Helpful. 20' walk from the South station (and therefore to the airport connections) The added value is that Boston is not a cheap town so this is a really good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, but worked for me”
Reviews.Author: QoB
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a clean, basic hotel for one night close to South Station, and for my purposes, the Milner Hotel did well. Pros: -- Location (in the Theatre District; close to Chinatown, New England Medical Center, Boston Common; the Orange, Green and Silver T lines are nearby; 10 minutes walk from South Station) -- Free internet -- Breakfast included (was pleasantly surprised by the variety - 10 kinds of tea; 5 kinds of cereal; fruit salad; yogurt; bagels; pastries; coffee etc.) -- Rooms were clean, good hot water Cons: -- Room was very small -- DÃ©cor was obviously old. If I wanted a longer stay in Boston, I'd probably get a better deal on another hotel, but for one night this was the cheapest in the area, and perfectly fine on the important things like cleanliness, service, and value. I do wish they'd redecorate. The wallpaper really is dreadful...

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, great location”
Reviews.Author: dontgetoutmuch2112
Reviews.Content: After mixed reviews on this hotel I didn't know what to expect. It was small with no view, but who cares, it was in the heart of the city, and brief walk away from the theatre district, and Jacob Wirth's - an excellent brew house for all your beer-fans! The place was clean, and the people that worked there were all courteous. We didn't go to any shows in the theatre district, but if I return for that reason I know where I'd want to stay.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant - good location - good value”
Reviews.Author: GainesvilleEcotours
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly and I was upgraded to a top floor room with Queen bed and sitting area. Bathroom was on small size and hotel is not brand spanking new. However bed was nice and firm as were the pillows and linens etc were all clean. Would definitely stay there again as it is conveniently located to downtown and Boston Commons and is good value. Definitely recommend for single business traveller or couple on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “No Room, Even with Confirmation”
Reviews.Author: LouisianaLady009
Reviews.Content: Arrived around 8pm with confirmation number in hand, and were told that our "reservation had been cancelled". And, that they were booked and could not accomodate us. And, made very little effort to try to help us find a room in a supposedly "all booked" city. Milnor claimed that Hotels.com cancelled our reservation, but we have no record of that. Terribly disappointed. Looked old and dumpy, anyway, so it was probably for the best.

Reviews.Title: “hotel is ok, the location top”
Reviews.Author: Gothgirlie
Reviews.Content: it is quite an old hotel - the room was very small, but if you're only there to take a shower and sleep its definitely ok, considering that there is breakfast and internet included and they have a 24-hr reception, 2 minutes from the boston common and public garden as well as chinatown and the theatre district the location is really great

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Milner!”
Reviews.Author: MooreFarms
Reviews.Content: Great location, room was everything we needed: small but clean and had coffee maker, hair dryer, iron, tv...we had a quick trip so we didn't need a plush suite or anything. For the location and rate it was perfect. New employee at reception desk was very nice and helpful. We did not have have breakfast in the morning but it looked average, certainly as good as what you would get at most budget hotels. Our room near the elevator and was not noisy as we read in other reviews, we slept great. Used the high speed and got discounted parking at nearby garage with validation. We like historic hotels so we thought it was cool!

Reviews.Title: “Awsome Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pinkmst
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel while in Boston to see a show. The hotel staff was really nice, the breakfast was tasty and the room was clean. Althogh the rooms are small it is more then enough to sleep in if you order the right size. The hotel truly is in the heart if the theatre district only a block or two away from the Colonial and Wang. Also city place is VERY close for food. There are also tour on and off stopsp within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT book this hotel”
Reviews.Author: dzufelt
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for the location, and in their defense, that is the only thing going for this hotel. However, in hindsight, I would definitely pay the other $20-30 for one of the other hotels in this area. I was prepared for small rooms, no view, and a generally old fashioned hotel. What we got were worn down, dingy rooms. The bathroom was so tiny that you literally can only get in sideways and the showers are a square of plastic lining on the floor with a drain and a shower curtain. We paid for a Queen, it was not a queen, it was a full, but the hotel staff stubbornly incisted that it was a queen (it was not). Also, the mattress was so old and worn out that it sunk down in the middle. When we asked for another room the desk clerk said he couldn't do anything until the manager arrived but said he would call us back in 30 minutes. They called back the next day. I was hoping that what the hotel lacked, the staff would make up for with customer service. That was not the case at all. This is not worth the money you may or may not save to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A visit to Lilliput”
Reviews.Author: Seein'_the_world
Reviews.Content: Everything but the bill was tiny. The tiny, ancient elevator has no sensor and closes on patrons. Nothing but double beds here. Our room had two, but was so small that the two beds and TV sitting on a dresser created a twisty path to the second bed which would not be approved by OSHA. The toilet had an elongated bowl with a small, round seat. The teensy tub was so narrow, I had to stand sideways to shower (good hot water). Even the towels are small. The mattresses were worn out but the sheets and pillows are high quality. The breakfast room is so tiny it only holds four bistro tables and eight chairs. A hotel employee was so determined to keep everything stocked and cleaned up but wound up just adding to the lack of space. Our window looked out onto the brick wall of the next building. The location is good--just two blocks from the Commons. Can pick up the Freedom Trail or Old Town Trolley for sightseeing. Since it is just off the Theater District, there are good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: jenipowell
Reviews.Content: My friend and I recently stayed at the Milner as we were running in the Boston Marathon. We were a little leary and expected the worse due to some previous reviews. Once we arrived at the hotel we were pleasantly surprised. The lobby and breakfast area were cute. Our room was great, two double beds and very roomy. It felt as if we were at a bed and breakfast. The breakfast was great which included muffins, danishes etc. cereal, waffles, toast, yogart, fresh fruit, juice, coffee tea etc. The coffee, tea and hot chocolate were available 24 hours. For the runners they also had in the lobby lots of complimentary bottles of water in ice and fresh fruit and granola bars for us. All the staff was very friendly and helpful. Better than all that too was that we got a great internet price for the four nights we stayed. I would definately stay there again as well as recommend it to anyone who stayed in Boston. It was so close to the Boston Common, Beacon Hill where Cheers is, the T (subway) and the end of the Boston Marathon. You could walk all around the downtown area of Boston from this Hotel....Thanks The Milner for a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Warning - Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: 99mph
Reviews.Content: What a near disaster! Made reservations here for the weekend of the Boston Marathon. When making confirmation for my stay they had no record of me reserving there. Was barely able to get a room somewhere else at considerably more money and it wasn't near as close to the area I wanted to be. YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED - Stay Away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location to visit Boston”
Reviews.Author: frab83
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Milner hOtel " nights at the end of Oct 2008. The staff was always very helpfull and rooms was not moderns but very well equipped and very clean.The Hotel is a few step from Boston Common and from Theatre district.Really great was the breakfast including every kind of delicious....Yogurt,Pancakes fruit juie tea coffe donuts...really great also the price!!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid At All Costs”
Reviews.Author: mollytruly
Reviews.Content: Please avoid this hotel at all costs-- this place is a public health hazard!!! We checked in yesterday, and were on the bed watching a movie when my companion noticed a small black bug crawling across our restaurant guide. She squished it and it was filled with blood. I suspected bed bugs but didn't want to believe it, so I went online and sure enough, Harvard has a fact sheet on the web that described the bug to the tee (it was a juvenile,) including where to look and what signs to look for. We flipped up the mattress and the underside was crawling with adult bed bugs!!!! We were totally freaked out and pissed off. We went down to the desk, where they were nice and apologetic, and got a full refund. Small comfort considering we were exhausted and now looking for a hotel at 12:30 am. The worst part, however, was that the desk clerk told us this had been a problem before and they had sprayed but "I guess it didn't work." This hotel is clearly shady and please don't expose yourself to that kind of health risk-- we now have to disinfect our luggage and all of our stuff, what a pain. But better than the alternative-- bringing them home!!!

Reviews.Title: “If you like bedbugs you'll love the Milner Boston, MA”
Reviews.Author: FlyingLA
Reviews.Content: After about 20 minutes to get checked in, I was given a key to my room. I entered the very small room, walked into the restroom and was greeted by a small "beetle looking" bug on the floor. I thought, no worries, just a beetle. After a long day, it was time for bed. The sheets weren't the crispiest I'd ever seen, but this is a two-star hotel. When I woke up, I saw another "beetle" crawling across my pillow. I contacted the front desk and informed them about the "beetles". Throughout the day, I began itching. I noticed red bumps all over my body, I thought, "Oh my God! They have bed bugs!!" I complained and the management switched me to another room, which I learned (the hard way) had bed bugs as well. The bed bugs were one of the many problems at this hotel. The hotel is in desparate need of renovation. The bathroom tub was extremely grimy. This place needs need serious attention. It has potential, but it is poorly operated.

Reviews.Title: “A Throwback to the Simple life......”
Reviews.Author: SK8ERLasVegas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Milner prior to our cruise, we and another couple got quite a laugh out of our stay, after reading the reviews we were ready for the worst.......but actually enjoyed seeing what rooms were like eons ago....the narrow halls, the can't bend over showers, the three person elevator, and the miniscule breakfast room, and the outdoor old-fashioned fire escape.....but our room was very clean, the staff were pleasant and helpful and it was within walking distance of what we wanted to see....after staying in some of the newest ,most beautiful, and highest priced places, we would do the Milner again in a heartbeat..as for all the people who panned it, get a grip, slow down, and remember that Hilton did not build the first hotel........ m

Reviews.Title: “Did the job!”
Reviews.Author: davecox78
Reviews.Content: Hey, I went to the Milner with a degree of trepidation as the reviews were a mixed bunch. I decided to go there as it was central and cheap. Mathew and Jackie (cute) were cool at the front desk, chatty and helpful. I was a random English guy on my own, there to see the sights, so for me the hotel was fine. Yes the rooms are small, I was in 413, on the fire exit staircase (nice), and when 'Pearl's' club spilled out onto the streets you knew about it, and yet overall, the place was fine. I didn't do breakfast in the 'Nook', looked small, and to be honest breakfast in one of the many diner's in the city is much more fun. Give it a try if you just want a place to dump your stuff and get on with seeing a great city day and night. Gladis

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine for no-nonsense, no frills”
Reviews.Author: NorCTDnL
Reviews.Content: It's a perfectly fine place to hang your hat. When I'm travelling on business, I want clean, quiet, inexpensive, well located. I don;t want or need the luxury amenities. I'm not in my room enough to make those worth the price. I read the other reviews for Milner, and I suspect most of the negatives were from people with expectations of luxury. Nope. You wont get that. It's a bit dated, but the paint is relatively recent. Lighting could be improved to make the corridors more pleasant. Front desk staff was competent. (although one traveller did have issues with the newbie behind the front desk. Ultimately the manager took care of the problem). Morning breakfast was reasonable. Internet connection spotty. Room was TINY. I was travelling single, and I got single: a twin bed in a small room. But the room was quiet and clean. I booked for one night via a web site. Then, my business plans changed, so I called the hotel directly, got rebooked for another night, at $50 less than the web site! It's in a great location in the theatre/downtown district, near everything one needs. I'll go back. Not a place for the fantastic honeymoon or partiers. But fine if all you want is a clean, quiet, acceptable place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Location great, hotel a bit grotty”
Reviews.Author: dinkyninky
Reviews.Content: The hotel staffw ere lovely and welcoming. However, the hotel itself was not very clean, very run down in general, and in need of refurbishment. BUT great great location! To be reommneded for budget travellers, if you're not too fussy! the price was great too.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, not as bad a feared”
Reviews.Author: n6783
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a single room for 5 nights. Main reasons for choosing this hotel were price, location and availability. Was running in Boston marathon. Was a bit apprehensive after reading some of the reviews on this website before travelling, but it was not that bad. Hotel is more like a B&B/guest house with 24hr reception. Room had an AC/heater unit in window - this had to be kept on overnight as it was cold and wet when I stayed in Boston. Noise of unit may annoy some people, but when its keeping you warm you don't care! Room was small, there was no door separating the toilet/shower from the bedroom. Bed was against wall with window that did not shut flush, so had to stuff a pillow against window to keep cold out. Light switches looked ancient, took a while to get light a over bed on/off. Started off pulling socked in and out! Room was quiet, only noise was from traffic during night. Breakfast was eat as much as you want (or is that can). Cereal, bagels, make your own waffles, english muffins. Cereals in single serving boxes, so had to take more that one. Breakfast served in 2 quite small rooms, if hotel busy you may struggle to get a seat and just end up carrying it up to your room. Lift was out of order until morning I checked out, was on 1st floor so this didn't bother me.

Reviews.Title: “A vacuum cleaner never came there!”
Reviews.Author: pcato
Reviews.Content: This place is absolutely awful. The entrance and elevator were dirty to say the least, and the whole place looks completely worn. I had a 5 sqm room with a narrow bed and a dying mattress. Though on the 5th floor the noise from the street was invasive, and there was almost no heating. On the morning I had to wait 5 minutes tap open to get the first drop of hot water. Avoid this hotel, this is definitely not a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and Charming”
Reviews.Author: KeyWestGal44
Reviews.Content: Ok, so this is no Hilton, but I will tell you what, the hotel is really something. In a charming old building, very classic and right in the heart of the theatre district. Literally one block away for the T and near all theatres, shops, restaurants. Our room was adorable, very comfortably sized. Not ridiculously small as some people say. Nice breakfast, excellent service. Mark was wonderful, he's the manager. Very good prices and we will of course stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Close encounters !”
Reviews.Author: ExiledinAberdeen
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay at the Milner after reading a few reviews, it looked a reasonable kind of place to me. The rooms are clean but very small, if you want a closed in kind of feeling then this is the place for you. Not me, I would not choose to stay at the Milner again. The expression "you could not swing a cat" should come to your mind. The interior of the hotel could do with a bit of a tidy up. Location wise it's ok. Easy for walking in the city and public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Never, never, never stay here - grottiest hovel ever”
Reviews.Author: W0rking_traveller
Reviews.Content: I cannot over-emphasise how bad this hotel is. Do not stay here. Find a campsite or a cardboard box and sleep on the street. This is by far and away the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. Due to the large conference in Boston we were attending all the regular business hotels were fully booked and we ended up at this place. Once there, there was no chance we could move somewhere else as even airport hotels were booked. The place is absolutely filthy. Nothing works - and management are totally uninterested in getting things fixed. The airconditioning was blowing warm but the room was so hot that it was still better than leaving it off. The internet did not work and I complained twice a day for 5 days - not fixed. The handle broke off the toilet so it wouldn't flush. The shower ran out of hot water most days and ran lukewarm. We were put into single rooms F(defined as a "twin bed") which are the smallest rooms I have ever stayed in and featured a single bed designed for dwarves. My colleague is over 6 foot tall and was too long for the bed. Great for him given there was 3 inches clearance between the foot of the bed and the wall. The first single room I was put into was accessed through the fire exit stairwell and had no desk, had a basin in room itself, and physically not enough floor space to even open my suitcase. I got switched to one that included a desk and managed to jam the suitcase down at the end of the bed. No cupboard. to hang anything in. No chest of drawers. No iron. No drycleaning facilities - you can do your laundry downstairs. Not good if you are travelling for business. You inform the staff of issues and get a surly response. And nothing is dealt with. To reemphasise - this place is beyond tired. It is broken down and old. They could at least do the basics and clean the carpets which are brown and filthy and disgusting. It smells dirty. I could go on but I won't - I am looking forward to the Sheraton tonight.

Reviews.Title: “The worst place I have ever stayed...management should all be fired”
Reviews.Author: andrewpiner
Reviews.Content: This place is without a doubt the worst place I have ever stayed in the world. To start with, I get there to check in and the woman behind the counter blows me off for 20 MINUTES while she calls and talks to various people on the phone. THEN after all that she looks up to tell me that she then has to wait for someone else to come down before she can think about checking me in. Extremely frustrated I get them to hold my bags so that I can go and show my wife the city for her first time. When I get back, I have to go through the entire check in procedure all over again and then the guy behind the counter says he has to get a photo ID from everyone staying in the room WTH?? He says that it is case of fire they have a picture to look for me. To accomplish this they photocopy mine and my wife's driver's license and blanket out NOTHING. THIS IS A LIE!!!!! HE LIED RIGHT TO MY FACE!!! I then went the next morning to retrieve this photo since I was leaving they no longer need it. However, then I was told by the girl behind the counter that it is HOTEL POLICY to take ALL of these photos and forward them to the corporate office!!! it is not only a security risk, but with a drivers license number and address, ANYONE can get a credit card IN MY NAME. Neither talking with the girl behind the desk or the manager would get my info back. This policy is not posted anywhere or written down anywhere on any information, so if you don't want your information floating around their unknown databases, DON'T STAY THERE!!! Other reasons not to stay there: This room is the smallest room I have ever been in...in the entire world. There was literally 2 feet of space on three sides of the bed. The bed itself was a double size to boot so that tells you how small the room was. Of all of the "services" in the basement that they offered, the only things that were working was the vending machine with the disposable razors and the ice maker. The elevator does not have a safety release and nearly cut me in half. Fortunately, I work out so I was able to force the door back open.(This was at the lobby level and no one seemed to care about the fact that I was caught in the door. Not that I had a view, but the window didn't open either. In conclusion, this is the worst place I have ever stayed and I am now actively discouraging everyone to stay away from this place.

Reviews.Title: “An experience you'll tell friends about!”
Reviews.Author: geohab
Reviews.Content: As I recall, I wrote on the Milner's comment card that my room was so laughably terrible it was actually a fun experience. On top of everything, the floor sloped, so that when you got out of the bed to go to the bathroom, you wound up kind of "running" downhill! Even the manager, who came to the room to verify this, admitted the problem and gave me a slight reduction in the room rate. My stay at the Milner was the second worst I've ever had in my 50 years of traveling (the worst being in a small hotel outside Le Bourget Airport in Paris, where I had to hold a match in the lightless bathroom in order to see what I was doing, and where!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: pentlandbiker
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Milner to avoid stupid prices charged during the BIO convention. I expected the worst from the other reviews here - what a surprise! Very helpful staff from the moment I arrived. Great breakfasts, and free internet connection (that worked!). So what that the place is small, and could do with brightening up. When I go back to Boston I will go back to the Milner.

Reviews.Title: “Good value great location, stop whining”
Reviews.Author: Irishglobetrotter
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Milner after Arriving in Boston well after midnight on an Aer Lingus flight delayed 8 hours. I had to fight with Aer Lingus to get them to pay for my hotel because i was not going to arrive at my friends house after midnight so I choose the lowest rate. The desk clerk was friendly and efficient, the room was extremely small but compared to the other hotels in the area so was the price. The continental breakfast was a far cry from the normal coffee and donut most hotels offer. There was several cereals and juices, fruit, yogurts, Freshly made waffles and pastries plus tea and coffee. Like i said my room was very small but it had a bed a tv and phone with private bathroom at a very low price by downtown Boston prices. I cringed listenening to to guests moaning and whinging about stupid insignificant stuff trying to get a discount on the lowest rates in Boston. There was an English couple in front of me a the desk abusing the clerk telling her she was rude when they should have been arrested for their racist comments. If you want luxury stay at one of the 300+ per night hotels in the same area. Also remember the Milner has larger rooms for a little more money

Reviews.Title: “Hmmm... So So..”
Reviews.Author: BobLobblaw
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Milner on Sept 24-27. My stay was not nearly as bad as some of these other reviews. But I could easily see why some people had issues. It is a very "budget" hotel but has a great central location with plenty to do near by. Our room was small with 2 double beds and had a great view of a brick wall! No sunlight/view what so ever. I was a little leery of our bathroom as it had evidence of a leak in the ceiling from the room above. The paint was all bubbled and there was plenty of black mold to support my claim. The front desk staff was just fine by my account, but a friend of mine ran into one staffer that was far from friendly. Our room was cleaned and made up everyday, which was good. The hotel is in a good location. Lots to do and the train is a 5 minute walk and goes everywhere. We were out often at night and felt safe. But, down near The Common is a little different story. Pretty weird at night... beware. One thing that sucked.... our room keys had to be re-keyed each time we came back to the hotel. I guess they get screwed up if they touch anything! And I do mean anything. They didnâ€™t really check as to which room we were in either. We just told them the room number. I will recommend the Milner to those that are there for a clean place to sleep (well, minus the black mold) and are in town to see Boston, not the hotel. This is not a place for those people that are high maintenance and need perfect accommodations. There was also a little area with a continental breakfast. That was a good way to start the day in Boston. Might not get that perk from other budget hotels. On a scale of 1-10â€¦ I would give it a 5. I would agree with another persons review that it might be like â€œrolling the diceâ€� staying here. Hope this helps! Boston is a great place!!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, charming, much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: ylantz
Reviews.Content: I had booked the Milner through a website, then decided to check the reviews on TripAdvisor, and was afraid I had made a terrible mistake after seeing all the negative reviews. It would have cost me $25 to cancel, so I thought I would just take my chances. I'm happy to say it was much, much nicer than what I had expected. Colleen is a new manager and she couldn't have been friendlier. It was clean, and the breakfast area with black wrought iron tables and chairs had a European charm. The rooms are small, but I was only there to get my daughter settled in at her college, so it met our needs. I did not see any mold or notice any peculiar smells. The location is great, and we were able to walk to the Boston Common and dinner. There was not a lot of traffic on the street, which made getting around easy. So if you're just looking for a nice room for the night, I would recommend the Milner. Add another $20 for parking, though.

Reviews.Title: “Don't ever stay at the Milner Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JesseM
Reviews.Content: Anybody who is considering staying at the Milner Hotel should think twice. I made a reservation to stay here about a month before my stay. I arrived in Boston (flew in from Toronto) and took the 25 minute cab ride from the airport and found the Milner Hotel. The receptionist at the front desk said they had no record of my reservation. I gave her a confirmation code, but she said it wasn't valid. I asked to speak with her manager but she said he was not there. After an hour of talking on the phone to my travel agent (and her talking to the receptionist), we gave up and went elsewhere (the Milner Hotel was full, as was the entire city virtually because of conferences in Boston at the time). The only hotel we could find in the city was the Embassy Suites - nice place, but $350 a night! One month later, I received a charge on my credit card - for a no show charge - from the Milner hotel! I called my travel agent - she called the hotel. They did not return her call (big surprise) until she threatened to fly down and call CNN as this experience was horrible. Finally the manager called back. They had spelled my name wrong, AND had put my reservation down for the wrong month! The manager had to put my travel agent on hold because "the cleaning staff were in a fist fight". Although the manager did refund the no-show charge and credited my credit card for the difference for one night between the Milner ($150) and the Embassy Suites ($350), it was not worth the hassle and the Milner's rude staff. I suggest to avoid this hotel at all costs. They are unprofessional, rude, disorganized, and above were accusatory to me even though it ended up being their error. Go anywhere else but the Milner.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Is A Complete Toilet”
Reviews.Author: MrCheese
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived from the Airport I knew that We had made a terrible mistake. The Girl at the Check in was surly beyond belief, the lobby was knackered and depressing, the room was a cramped garret! I could only pass down one side of the bed and I was astonished to find that the air conditioning unit in the window above the bed head (12" from my forehead!) . It was quite impossible to sleep & I had to put the pillows at the other end of the bed, although I still awoke every time the damn thing started up! I have never written a wingeing report before but this one is totally justified.. We checked out after two nights and moved to the Radisson over the street, where we enjoyed sumptuous comfort and civility for $50 per night LESS!!!! AVOID THIS FLEA PIT!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth It at Any Price”
Reviews.Author: CarlosBBB
Reviews.Content: Spare Yourself!!! Those travelers who found the Milner acceptable speak to its lower rates compared to the expensive Boston area, allowing use of disposable income for other activities. My experience was that the savings were Not Worth the stress & aggravation caused by the dirty premises, questionable safety of the area, and Horrendous customer service. NOTE that the Company's Membership in Better Business Bureau WAS REVOKED for unresolved complaints in Jan 2006 - you can check this on BBB website. Despite this, they still post a BBB sticker. That in itself should be a read flag!! I stayed here with a group of co-workers because our company's travel service identified it as a reasonably priced option for business travel. We will ensure that it is removed as an option. This is NOT a business hotel - there is no desk or workspace, and the data port sables barely reach to the bed. Lighting is poor. The area is shady â€“ I spoke to a police officer on the street and he said the block is known for â€œa lot of drug dealingâ€� and to be careful. From that point on I only took cabs, rather than tried to walk from the hotel. Many of the other reviewers have noted how dank, dirty, poorly ventilated the property is, so I won't focus on that aspect except to Agree. My room smelled, the floor was continually damp & I had to lay out towels to walk around. It was the kind of place where you did not want to think about the cleanliness of mattress or pillows or you would not be able to sleep. But the WORST was the "Customer Service" â€“ the word service is inappropriate, as dealing with staff entailed a mixture of apathy (desk clerks) & hostility (manager). Rates of return business are almost certainly Nil & the company has no investment in customer satisfaction. Most of the time the desk is staffed by disinterested young people who are busy chatting with friends on cell phones or staring off into space - they deflect requests/complaints with reflexive statement of impotence "There is nothing I can do", or lame, substanceless excuses â€œIt's company Policy". Taking things to 'The Manager" produced several Shouting Matches, with immediate escalation - something I have never experienced in all my business or personal travel. Do not expect anyone to ask â€˜What can I do to resolve the problem or improve your stay?â€� in This Dump. The only reason I did not try to get out immediately after setting my first foot in the place was lack of alternatives due to crowding of downtown by conferences. If the Milner is the only available hotel, better to reschedule your trip. Plan ahead and avoid it!! Awful, Awful, Awful!!

Reviews.Title: “NASTY!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jenninboston
Reviews.Content: The only somewhat positive aspect of this dump is its location. Even then, at nighttime, it is sketchy being on the fringe of the combat zone. I ended up staying here because it was the only place left with a room because of a Microsoft convention. I checked out the next afternoon after I spent hours calling other hotels in town and got lucky with a cancellation. Moving to a Holiday Inn felt like the Four Seasons. This hotel is filthy and rundown. It reminded me of a seedy hotel from a horror movie. There is a mildewy odor in the air throughout the lobby which follows you into the room. I stayed in room 208 where there was an air conditioner in the window which was not doing much to cool the room despite all the noise it was making. To my dismay, the window in which the unit was sitting had no lock. There was a fire escape just outside the window which went down to ground level. I was sitting in my underwear when some man appeared right outside the window next to the bed on this fire escape. I asked the front desk for a stick to jam into the window so noone could open the window. I ended up using coat hangers. Furthermore, there was no chain or alternative lock to the door. I normally do not worry about these things, but felt unsafe after seeing some stranger outside my window. This place reminded me of a youth hostel you might stay in while backpacking through Europe. Actually, it was worse than that. There were dark stains on the dark carpet which also felt damp. The bathroom was nasty. The faucet handle came off every time I tried to turn on the water. There was cracked paint and mildew everywhere. The front desk person was some apathetic, mindless shift worker who was obviously there because they couldn't find a better job. I dreaded staying here after reading previous reviews and want to save all others from a nightmare experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good price; tiny, modest room; you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Robin from Hudson
Reviews.Content: Every major hotel in the neighborhood was booked solid for a Microsoft conference, so I took a chance on the Milner. I stayed in a single room with a twin bed on the 5th floor ($108 including tax and breakfast, booked via Expedia.) The room was quite small, modestly furnished with a sink/mirror in the bedroom and a private bath with a toilet and shower stall. The room also had a window air conditioner, a TV, and free wired internet access; but it had no desk, so I worked at my laptop while seated on the bed. Oddly, the floor was not level, with a distinct downhill slope from the bed toward the bathroom. The bed was comfy--though tilted slightly to one side, like the floor beneath--and the room was cozy and quiet, so I slept soundly. Concerns: the lobby, elevator, hallways, and breakfast room were not air conditioned and felt quite uncomfortable in the July heat. I went downstairs for breakfast, and like other reviewers I enjoyed the make-your-own waffle iron, but it heats up the already airless breakfast room and makes it miserably hot. There are a couple of tables in a little alcove just across from the breakfast room where it's a little cooler. An air conditioner in the breakfast room would be a big improvement. The Milner is comparable to a 2-star hotel in Europe, which is to say it's fine for one or two night's stay on business, but I wouldn't go there on vacation and I certainly wouldn't take my 70-year-old mother there. It's one of the most modest hotel properties I've seen in any major city in the US. Still, the low price and convenient location are big plusses. With the money I saved on accomodations I was able to treat myself to a lovely meal at the nearby Legal Seafood Restaurant, and I was just a couple of minutes away on foot from my business meeting at the Park Plaza. I'd say I got what I paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Milner - Gag me with a rope”
Reviews.Author: NYman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked with the Milner. This was our second choice as the hotel we normally use in Cambridge was full due to some conferences in town. I hesitated to give the wost rating because I can imagine that for some people it might have gone OK. However, if you have any problems, you might as well forget about it. Wnen we checked in we noticed that the window AC unit was not cooling (I used to do comercial and residential HVAC work, so I checked it out myself before alerting the front desk). After I determed that is wasn't working, I told the person at the front desk about the problem. She assured me that theywould take care of the problem. When I got up in the morning I told the Morning person at the front desk about the problem. She assured me that she would report it to maintenance. When we arrived back at our room that evening, it han not been looked at. I know this because we put folded up papers to hold the air fins (they were broken too) straight. These papers hadn't been touched. The room was blazing and the weather was calling for 90s the next two days. The person at the front desk said they didn't have a room available to move us into and said there was nothing he could do. My wife called the other hotel we usually use. They had some cancellations, so I told them we would be right over. When I told the front desk attendant that we were leaving and that I would not pay for the second night, they suddenly found another room. After quite an argument, they decided not to charge us for the second night. Additionally the ice machine didn't work and they seemed to be unable to do anything about it. If you luck out and get a room to your liking and with everything working, it would be a servicable low budget hotel in a great location. However, if you have any problems at all, you can forget about anything getting fixed. My advice is that if you are willing to roll the dice, then go ahead. However, a few more dollars is worth the peace of mind.

Reviews.Title: “Overcharged us, really small and uncomfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: They charged us for 4 nights and we stayed for three. We didn't realize this until it was too late, because they were rushing us to check out (there was a line). The place is really old and the pull out bed was less comfortable then the floor. The rooms are really small too. While it may seem like a deal when they overcharge you, its not worth it. The location is ok.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked the Milner through a hotel discount web site. I was only staying one night to pick someone up. I was initially going to stay at the hotel alone but plans changed and there were 2 of us staying overnight. The discount web site told me to just let the hotel know when I arrived. If anyone other than the hotel staff ever tells you this, contact the hotel beforehand since the hotel usually isn't aware this is being done!! They were totally booked but Monica, the front desk attendant told me she would wait for the manager to come back & see what she could do as far as juggling rooms to accommodate us. I had arrived earlier than check in time, but Monica arranged for me to have a room with a full bed as opposed to a twin bed and the management also arranged for me to check in earlier. The room was small and clean but it was what I had expected for the price. The staff at the hotel are very helpful and attentive giving me valuable tips on things to do and see in Boston. I would stay there again because the people were so personable and accommodating.
