Reviews.Title: “wonderful old hotel w/ plumbing troubles. Awesome Staff.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was suppose to stay across the street at the Radisson for $170 conf. rate and they were ---- so I decided to find something else. I was really pleased with how NICE the Milner staff are and how well trained. It has cable & high speed internet. The hotel is older (18XX) and yes, rooms are small -- but big enough to get around. People at the conf. complained they paid $200+ for 25x45 rooms at their hotels "bowling alleys". I got the rack rate of $120 (minus some haggling) but I see on line you can get $90. It is CENTRAL to the theatre district. Every room I went into was clean and the mattresses were super comfortable, so I don't understand some of the other reviews. My review could be horrible! Our toilet exploded at 11:00 at night and they were fully booked. They gave us a key to a room under renovation, a steep discount and moved us to a bigger room the next morning (with a loose sink faucet). Mostly, though, they were super nice about it. Not the brown-nose "oh we are soooo sorry but there is nothing we can doooo." They wanted to solve the problem. The manager lives on site and they woke him up to figure it out. He's amazing. I've interacted with 5 shifts of staff and everyone has been very very very nice and professional. People who have stayed in non-chain hotels in big cities like New York or SF or are familiar with European hotels will have the right mind set for room size. If you want a huge King bed and two nightstands and room to land a helicopter in your living room -- you will have to pay for that and get it somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “You could stay in a worse place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It's as simple as this. The rooms are quite small, the decoration is old fashioned BUT, it's safe and in a super location and is really cheap compared to anything else in the area. It's ideal for anyone on a budget who only plans to use the place to sleep - afterall, the rest of Boston is so good why would you need to stay in much? I personally found the staff helpful and the hotel easy to find, which is not the view of other reviews but I can only jusge as i find.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value / Tiny Rooms”
Reviews.Author: psasquatch99
Reviews.Content: There is no other way to put it but the rooms are tiny. The running joke between myself and my group was "I have to go outside to change my mind". I stayed in a room with two double beds, which had no closet and a very small dresser, but it was very clean and had a quite comfortable bed. Staff was friendly and helpful in giving directions to local places. Continental Breakfast of coffee, assorted teas, waffles, bagels, fruit & cereals was good as well. The location is great, two blocks from orange line subway & a block and a half from the Rock Bottom Brewery (highly recommend â€œGood Beer & Foodâ€�). Overall, I have stayed in much nicer and much worse; I would defiantly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Charming & Friendly Place”
Reviews.Author: dancequeen33
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel sight unseen,based only on website,price and great location. It is old, but very clean and quaint. Every staff member made us feel welcome and took the time to answer questions and make suggestions on places to eat and see. Breakfast was included and the rooms were cozy, yet spacious. We were able to walk to Boston Commons,Beacon Hill,Chinatown and The Freedom Trail. There were several bars & restaurants within a one-mile or less radius. I believe we received good value for our money.The day we left, it was raining, so the manager secured us a cab, and he and his assistant even helped us with our luggage. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible manner!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The manager of this hotel was terrible. Even if we made a reservation in advance, this guy expelled us out of this hotel. This was so terrible experience. This hotel was the worst hotel that I have stayed so far. You should be careful. Additionally, the room was so small and very uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: bostona
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the location/price ratio. Rooms are very small (all are different, you can end up in a small one but also in a relatively large one) but clean and the staff is very nice. Location is unbeatable. Unless you want spend twice as much. If you plan to stay for more than a couple of days, plan on getting a large room, not a single. I go back there every year and I strongly raccomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up for the Milner”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Before going to Boston but after booking the Milner, I read the reviews of other people and felt sick to my stomach. I considered canceling my reservation but was too busy so decided to just go and was pleasantly surprised. Yes, my room was small, but very cute and cozy. The hotel had a very nice atmosphere as well. If you've ever traveled in Europe and stayed in 2 - 3 star hotels, you'll know what I mean. No, it wasn't new and, being an older hotel, the oldest in Boston apparently, not everything was in perfect condition, but I think you have to expect that. The manager was great and very receptive to my concerns. The staff were professional, friendly and helpful. As for the breakfast, also very nice, especially because of the fresh fruit. I don't mind eating with plastic utensils. I thought my stay at the Milner was very good. I slept well, was very centrally located, and was treated well by the staff. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: dscott12
Reviews.Content: Please! stay away from the Horrible Hotel, the rooms are not much bigger than closets, the tv did not work, the toilet leaked all over the bathroom floor, the beds are horrible, the shower curtain was half as wide as the tub so it was impossible to take a shower without getting water all over the bathroom floor. do yourself a favor and stay very far away from this absolutely terrible hotel! consider yourself warned

Reviews.Title: “A Picture Is Worth 1000 Words - It's Not A Place I Would Stay Again !!”
Reviews.Author: rastro
Reviews.Content: There are much better places to stay for the Same $$$. The management talked customers into cancelling their "pre-paid" hotel bookings so he could "sell" you a much better deal .. I don't think so .. A picture is worth 1,000 words... Take a look... You decide. Small Room - Dirty Bathrooms - Small Hallway I rate it a 1/2 star - Signed a Hotel Expert ... Pics Takes Nov. 2004

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: Gracesdad
Reviews.Content: Blessed are those who expect nothing for they shall not be disappointed. You will still be disappointed here though, there is a foul odour upon entering the foyer and the staff are in the main unhelpful. The rooms are small, unclean, and in need of maintenance, not to mention the pungent smell in the rooms too. You may be on a tight budget, but there are better options for you.

Reviews.Title: “hated it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent five long nights at this "quaint" hotel. Staying anywhere but home for five nights is difficult, but it was made even more so at the Milner. The staff did not seem welcoming or knowledgable about anything pertaining to the hotel and the rooms were dingy and cheap looking. The room did not look updated nor very clean...maybe it was the cement block walls painted lime green with red accents??? For some reason the Milner felt more like a hostel for senior citizens.
